definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: The builder cost out the job at $6, 500.
sentences.chinese: 营造商给这活儿估价为6，500美元。

sentences.english: The builder costed the job at $1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这活儿营造商估价为一千元。

sentences.english: The organization has issued a set of guidelines for builders to follow.
sentences.chinese: 该组织为营造商制订了一套指导方针。

sentences.english: He eked out his wages by working evenings and Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 营造商星期五给他的工人发工钱。

sentences.english: We asked our builder to estimate for the repair of the ceiling .
sentences.chinese: 我们要求营造商估算一下修理天花板的费用。

definition: to supervise and construct/constructed under the supervision of
Pei Ieoh Ming or I.M. Pei (1917-2019), Chinese-American architect
